channel.title: I can't connect on my other computer!
channel.description:
Hello guys, here is a pic of my personal client that i use to connect to my server:
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/client1.gif[/img]
as u can see it connects normally:
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/client2.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/client3.gif[/img]
Here is a picture of the webclient that everyone else uses to connect:
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/menu1.gif[/img]
Here is what happens when i try to log in on my other non-host computer:
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/menu2.gif[/img]
[IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/menu3.gif[/img]
as u can see it won't let me connect through the webclient. This only happens to me when i go on a different computer in my house and try to connect to my server from that.
can someone tell me why? or how i can fix it?

item.title: I can't connect on my other computer!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

If you’re running a server, it should be done on a server system. It is fine to test things out on your development machine and let a few people try tests, but your personal computer will be ‘chewing’ resources on the graphical user interface and other various graphical tasks. The performance will also vary depending on what you’re doing on it at a referenced time. A machine dedicated to running the server will prevent security exploits to your personal machine as well as dedicate the resources required.

Read full topic
item.source: I can't connect on my other computer!

item.title: I can't connect on my other computer!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:8, topic:384366”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=480126.msg3514918#msg3514918 date=1298896638]

listen on the actual IP address of your computer

Or you can use no-ip, so other people don’t see your IP Address.
[/quote]You shouldn’t run a production server off of your personal computer full stop.[/quote]
Really? Do you happen to know why?

Read full topic
item.source: I can't connect on my other computer!

item.source: I can't connect on my other computer!

item.title: I can't connect on my other computer!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Your socket listener is listening on localhost (127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0). You have to modify your server to listen on the actual IP address of your computer or whatever the host they are connecting to is. I suggest setting the listener host at runtime using an argument, that way you do not have to recompile when running it locally or publically.

Read full topic
item.source: I can't connect on my other computer!

item.title: I can't connect on my other computer!
item.dc:creator: @Zhawa Zhawa
item.description:
@Zhawa wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:4, topic:384366”][quote author=mrpopyman link=topic=480126.msg3514790#msg3514790 date=1298875600]
so how do i connect locally on my second computer (on the webclient)
[/quote]
127.0.0.1[/quote]

You cannot connect locally from another computer

Each computer on a network has the same IP, but each computer has its own ‘uid’ if you like.

So each computer is unique so you would connect as a normal user with the ip address of the host computer

Read full topic
item.source: I can't connect on my other computer!
